Description: Fragment from the neck and shoulder area of a sleeveless tunic (a) with applied, brocaded band (b) and sewn on coloured, cords; (a) in weft-faced plain weave, black wool; Warp is used vertically, fold on shoulders, selvedges at sides; (a) warp: S spun, c.15 tpc; (a) weft: S spun, c.30 tpc; Edges: selvedge along and below arm hole-reinforced outer cordeline, other edges ragged or cut; Sewing: mainly overcasting in S spun, Z ply green wool thread. (b) Band runs along the shoulder, across the arm opening and pleated round the U-shaped neck; Yellow, red and green cords, used together, edge the band in places, and at the front and back of the neck and below the arm, form loops and lozenges; Band of red wool, with brocaded decoration in undyed linen and (in border) yellow wool; Brocading weft paired, in every shed, staggered binding points; Design of half lozenges with formalised bisected flowers at centre; On one side, narrow border with a string of small lozenges; (b) warp: S spun, Z ply, c.16 tpc; (b) weft: S spun, c.13 tpc; Edges: two selvedges, cut ends turned under; Cords: wool S spun, 4 cover 2 Zply.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, green box; Edges cut after excavation; Neck would probably originally have opened with a flap; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (7.9.1989)
Condition: (a) Poor, discoloured and fragmentary; unknown date stuck down badly; (b) Medium - in places linen perished.
Acquisition notes: Collection purchased at sale on 6th Dec 1954, lots 154, 155 and 156.
